summary: This document is an email chain between FBI Victim Specialists discussing referrals for counseling and support services for victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails focus on identifying vetted, trauma-focused agencies in the West Palm Beach area for victims affected by Epstein's suicide and media attention.

persons.name: VS M
persons.context: FBI Victim Specialist who works the West Palm Beach area and provided initial agency referrals for human trafficking cases.

connections.description: Both are FBI Victim Specialists collaborating on finding appropriate victim services for Epstein victims.

events.title: Initial referral list provided
events.description: FBI Victim Specialist M. emails a list of three agencies (Catholic Charities, Palm Beach County Victim Services, International Rescue Committee) for Epstein victim referrals.

events.title: Follow-up on victim service referrals
events.description: FBI personnel discuss concerns about the appropriateness of previously listed referral agencies and seek vetted, trauma-focused services for Epstein victims.

events.title: Victim requests counseling
events.description: An Epstein victim reaches out via text message stating that Epstein's suicide and constant media attention have affected her and she needs counseling services.

keyFacts: Epstein victims were actively seeking counseling services in August-October 2019 following his suicide and intense media scrutiny.
FBI Victim Specialists were coordinating to find appropriate, vetted, trauma-focused service agencies for victims in the West Palm Beach area.
There was internal FBI concern about the suitability of some referral agencies, with emphasis on using properly vetted resources for this sensitive case.
The International Rescue Committee was identified as providing services for human trafficking victims including counseling, housing, and financial assistance.
Executive Management instructed that victims should only be referred to trauma-focused and vetted agencies due to the case's sensitivity.
